tool.name: MiRDeep2 Quantifier
tool.description: fast quantitation of reads mapping to known miRBase precursors
tool.command:
quantifier.pl
-p $precursors
-m $mature
-r $reads
#if $species.value != 'all' -t $species #end if
#if $star_sequences -s $star_sequences #end if
$sortReadsInPDF $flexibleIdMapping $skipFileConversion $wholePrecursAsMature $discardReadMultiMap
-e $upstreamNtides -f $downstreamNtides -g $allowedMismatches -y galaxy
## html output ; cp expression_galaxy.html $html 2> /dev/null
## move pdf directory to be accessible from the new index.html ; mkdir -p $html.files_path 2> /dev/null ; cp -R pdfs_galaxy $html.files_path 2> /dev/null

param.name: species
param.label: Search in species
param.help: If not searching in a specific species all species in your files will be analyzed. (-t)

param.name: sortReadsInPDF
param.label: Sort reads by sample in PDF

param.name: flexibleIdMapping
param.label: Include ID-flexible mapping
param.help: Also considers precursor-mature mappings that have different ids, eg let7c would be allowed to map to pre-let7a. (-k)

param.name: wholePrecursAsMature
param.label: Consider the whole precursor as the 'mature sequence'

param.name: upstreamNtides
param.label: Upstream nucleotides
param.help: Number of nucleotides upstream of the mature sequence to consider. (-e)

param.name: downstreamNtides
param.label: Downstream nucleotides
param.help: Number of nucleotides downstream of the mature sequence to consider. (-f)

param.name: allowedMismatches
param.label: Allowed mismatches
param.help: Number of allowed mismatches when mapping reads to precursors. (-g)

tool.help:
**What it does**
The module maps the deep sequencing reads to predefined miRNA precursors and determines by that the expression of the corresponding miRNAs. First, the predefined mature miRNA sequences are mapped to the predefined precursors. Optionally, predefined star sequences can be mapped to the precursors too. By that the mature and star sequence in the precursors are determined. Second, the deep sequencing reads are mapped to the precursors. The number of reads falling into an interval 2nt upstream and 5nt downstream of the mature/star sequence is determined.
**Input**
A FASTA file with precursor sequences, a FASTA file with mature miRNA sequences, a FASTA file with deep sequencing reads and optionally a FASTA file with star sequences and the 3 letter code of the species of interest.
**Output**
A tab separated file with miRNA identifiers and its read count, a signature file, a html file that gives an overview of all miRNAs the input data and a pdfs that contains for each miRNA a pdf file showing its signature and structure.
